bibl.title: Letter from Robert Carter to Josiah Burchet, May 13, 1727

div1.p: Robert Carter writes to Josiah Burchet, May 13, 1727, to cover a bill of exchange (not present) for fees for 4 passes for ships sailing to the Mediterranean.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Carter to Josiah Burchet, May 13, 1727

opener.dateline:
[Lancaster County,] Virginia
May 13th: 1727
Josiah Burchet Esqr.

div1.p:
The Occasion of this is to Enclose to
You a bill of Exche. for £5:-:- on Mr. Micajh: Perry of Lond[on]
being your fees for four Medeteranian passes, which I have
Issued in the Time of my Administration of this Governmnt: I am
div1.closer:
Sir
Yor: most humble Servt:
per Hopkins
Copy per Woodward

div1.head: NOTES
div1.note: Source copy consulted: Robert Carter Letter Book, 1727 April 13-1728 July 23, Carter Family Papers, Virginia Historical Society, Richmond.
[1] Burchet is presumed to have been an Admiralty official responsible for collecting the fees for passes. See footnote #2.

[2] "Mediterranean Passes were provided for English ships by the Admiralty in order to give protection against attack from the Corsairs of the Barbary Coast." This statement is given in describing copies of records of these passes found in ADM/7 in the Public Record Office available for purchase on microfilm. (http://www.microform.co.uk/html/body_african.html, 1/23/03)
